name: Hotel de France

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were here on business and decided to extend our stay for a couple more days,since the hoel was such a good base.
reviews.title: Great base
The beautiful days in Toulouse
reviews.text: It is on the doorstep of lots of bars and restaurants, markets, including the famous Victor Hugo food market, (literally across the road).

reviews.title: Great location, friendly staff and nice room
reviews.text: We requested a quiet room and got a lovely, clean simple little room on the 5th floor. Free WiFi had recently been installed and even worked well on the 5th floor. One occassion the internet was not working, we called reception and it was sorted out within minutes.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here for a night in July.
reviews.title: Friendly, well refurbished and well located

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel seems to have been fully refurbished. It was very comfortable and is a business / city centre sort of place. The staff were nice and there was plenty for breakfast.
reviews.title: Great Hotel in Good Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The hotel is well located being five minutes from the central railway station (not the TGV station of course) and a short walk to the old town.
reviews.title: Great room, great location and very stylish

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011
reviews.text: Would be very happy to stay here again.
reviews.title: Lovely Hotel with efficient staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled on business
reviews.text: Although we try to avoid business hotels, this one is just great. The location is good - very central for the shopping and restaurant areas in Valence, but quiet at the same time. The rooms are modern, clean and comfortable - good value too. The hotel staff couldn't do enough to help and were great ambassadors. I'd recommend staying here if in Valence and would look to book with them again.
reviews.title: Lovely & Welcoming

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: I stayed with my wife and 4 year old daughter at the Hotel de France while attending a wedding in August. We stayed for 4 nights and were very impressed by this small hotel which is in one of the most picturesque towns in France I have visited. As the hotel is only a 2* property I was not expecting to have a very comfortable stay, however the hotel was excellent value, providing comfortable, clean accommodation – an ideal base for any family visiting the region.
reviews.title: Extremely friendly owners – A great Stay Thanks

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I have to particularly compliment the owners Laurence and Jean-Bernard, who were so friendly and accommodating; particularly one evening when a group of 10 of us were looking to dine late (after 21:00) and no other restaurant would accommodate us, they laid on some excellent food for us at little notice.
reviews.title: Really friendly economical hotel in a very pretty town!
Still a first class choice
reviews.text: Stayed here again in for one night en route to the south. Same room as last year. Just as pleased with it. Valence was warm and lively on the main street that night. Made the mistake of choosing the Cafe Bancel opposite the hotel as the venue as it looked inviting to sit outside on a balmy evening. Overcooked fillet steak, overlooked and reheated chips and rock hard day old bread. Magnet de Canard was OK. drinks service was desultory and something that tasted like Marc was passed off as being Remy Martin (it was later claimed to be Bisquit but even that was dubious). Later had two Remy's back at the Hotel. €32!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had pretty good breakfasts at hotel previously but fancied one at a street cafe and found one at e Cafe Victor Hugo on the street of the same name a few yards west of the hotel. Orange presse, coffee, croissants, bread and jam for €14 and bags of atmosphere.
reviews.title: Hit the spot !!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled on business
reviews.text: At €99 plus parking the quality of this hotel compared with the Campanile at Troyes at €78 is good value.
reviews.title: Love This Place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hello again Folks,
reviews.title: Easy town-centre parking as well!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Please find our fair and independent review of Hotel Le France, Valence. If you find the review of some help, please take the time to press the helpful button at the end. Thanks.
reviews.title: Reasonably good business hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a recently refurbished hotel in central Valence. Excellent example of a two star city hotel. Good base for exploring the region and the city of Valence. Attentive and professional staff with excellent language skills for the non-french speakers.
reviews.title: Lovely, quiet city centre hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled on business
reviews.text: Upon arrival in my hire car, I saw the car park first. It was open space with spaces clearly marked on the ground. It was also secure with a great big gate at the front. There is a lift from the car park to all floors making this hotel very good for wheelchair access.
reviews.title: Use this hotel in Valence.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The reception/bar area was modern in style with couches and small bookcases. Very homely but also very modern. The bar area uses the veranda overlooking the car park but catches the sun perfectly. Not a busy bar but in all honesty, you'll be out in the town squares getting the local culture.
reviews.title: this hotel is a building site -avoid at all costs until you are sure its finished

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008
reviews.text: The floor I stayed on when the lift opened on it was a bit of a shock. It was bare Walls and not fully decorated. I did think I'd hit the wrong button. Sadly no one mentioned this to me. However, once I got in my room my opinion changed greatly. This was a very comfy room with a great shower room and seperate toilet. The view out over the town was good and didn't get much noise pollution. Just the odd siren from the police as they scoot past.
reviews.title: Be nice when it's finished

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel was still in the middle of being decorated and I saw significant improvements when I was there. The halls are being papered with nice paper, the carpets are down and the rooms are great. Some of my colleagues had stayed there before a couple of years ago and said it was a vast improvement.
reviews.title: Center of Town save money here

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled on business
reviews.text: Clean, design, good location !
reviews.title: Very nice place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Perfect for business or leisure travel
reviews.title: Great place to stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010
reviews.text: We paid 95 euros for a comfortable, clean, energy efficient, modern, quiet room. The bed was one of the most comfortable we had on our trip, and I greatly appreciated the abundance of pillows for reading. Furthermore the bed had a duvet with a changeable cover that is changed like the sheets. Therefore, you aren't using a bedspread that has been used by dozens of others without washing. The breakfast buffet had a wide variety of foods and the staff will cook eggs upon request for no extra charge. Finally, we appreciated being able to keep our car in the parking lot past checkout so we could explore the city some more.
reviews.title: Unimpressed for a hotel with a Michelin recommendation
Great Place to Stay!
reviews.text: I traveled to Valence and stayed at this hotel for two nights. Let me begin with the pros. The hotel is clean and Ikea-modern, the rooms are large and the beds were great. It is closely situated to the Gare de Valence-Ville, and there are lots of great bakeries around. Things I didn't like so much: This hotel is pretty expensive for what you get at 120 euros a night for two people. I have stayed at much nicer hotels state-side, like the Westin, and paid less. I had to pay for Wi-Fi. Now I'm sure you'll think I'm ridiculous in complaining about paying a very nominal fee for internet, but in my month of traveling around Europe, this was one of the most expensive hotels I stayed at and the only one without free Wi-Fi. Checkout was a disaster. After waiting ten minutes for the staff to correct the previous gentleman's bill, the front staff then handed me my bill which had a bar charge--I didn't have anything from the bar, nor did I give authority to anyone to use my room number. The staff member declared that I had to have done this and after five minutes of rudely arguing with me, finally removed the charge from my bill. I paid in cash, not the norm, I am sure, but the staff member stated there was no kind of a receipt she could give me showing I had paid my bill. I asked if she could sign my bill and write paid on it for my records, she rolled her eyes and told me that they didn't do that but would do so if it would appease me. I do not expect this kind of attitude and service from a place that has their Michelin recommendation posted on the window, and I certainly will not recommend it to anyone else.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I highly recommend the Hotel de France! Very clean, friendly staff and perfect location for walking to shops and restaurants. I stayed here for 5 weeks and had a lovely time.
reviews.title: Really nice stay

description: Located in the heart of Toulouse, in the city's most beautiful neighborhood. Restaurants, cafes, markets and the best brands shopping are just a few feet away from the Hotel's doorstep. Hotel de France has a rich history dating back to 1890. The newly remodeled rooms were designed to have the perfect combination of charm, convenience and comfort. Each room features a flat panel TV with satellite channels, complementary WIFI access, air-conditioning and a travertine-tiled bathroom.
